Description: Wall sherd (mended from three fragments, including 1888,0601.532j) of North Ionian pottery bowl; interior glazed streaky brown with two white-red-white bands; exterior, cream slip: two friezes preserved separated by stopt maeander bands between bands with superimposed red band lined in white; in upper frieze recumbent goat and grazing goat, to left; in lower, lotus bud and fkower on left, rear of goat on right.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.212)
